meanings.definition: to throw food and liquid up from the stomach
meanings.sentence: He felt so sick that he puked after the roller-coaster ride.

meanings.definition: the dead body of a person
meanings.sentence: The detectives covered the corpse before taking it to the morgue.

meanings.definition: to move gently back and forth or from side to side
meanings.sentence: The boat rocked gently on the waves.

meanings.definition: to choose not to do something, especially something enjoyable
meanings.sentence: She decided to abstain from eating sweets for a month.

meanings.definition: the act of choosing not to vote or participate
meanings.sentence: There were several abstentions during the council’s decision.

meanings.definition: to lose something as a result of a rule or mistake
meanings.sentence: They had to forfeit the game after using an ineligible player.

meanings.definition: having the right to do or receive something
meanings.sentence: Only students with good grades are eligible for the scholarship.

meanings.definition: not allowed to do or receive something
meanings.sentence: She was ineligible to vote because she had not registered.

meanings.definition: a person killed or injured in an accident or war
meanings.sentence: The earthquake caused hundreds of casualties in the city.

meanings.definition: an act of violent or open resistance to an authority
meanings.sentence: The villagers' rebellion against the governor failed quickly.

meanings.definition: to organize and present a performance or event
meanings.sentence: The school will stage a play in the auditorium next week.

meanings.definition: to attract or persuade someone to do something by offering something appealing
meanings.sentence: The company hopes to lure new customers with special discounts.

meanings.definition: to persuade someone to come out from hiding
meanings.sentence: The police used a loudspeaker to lure the suspect out of the house.

meanings.definition: showing a strong desire to punish someone for a wrong
meanings.sentence: After the argument, he felt vengeful and refused to speak to her.

meanings.definition: to stay in one place in the air
meanings.sentence: A hummingbird hovered near the flowers to drink nectar.

meanings.definition: to move slowly and quietly
meanings.sentence: The cat crept along the fence at night.

meanings.definition: to make someone feel nervous or scared
meanings.sentence: The silent doll in the corner really creeps me out.

meanings.definition: a tool used to turn screws
meanings.sentence: I used a screwdriver to tighten the loose handle on the door.

meanings.definition: unkind or unpleasant
meanings.sentence: Don’t be so mean—you hurt her feelings.

meanings.definition: to spend time doing nothing
meanings.sentence: We can’t just sit around all day—let’s find something to do.

meanings.definition: A loud and unpleasant noise
meanings.sentence: The children made such a racket that I couldn't concentrate on my work.

meanings.definition: Awkward in movement or handling things
meanings.sentence: He is so clumsy that he always drops his phone.

meanings.definition: A game where players hide while another tries to find them
meanings.sentence: The children played hide and seek in the backyard.

meanings.definition: in a very short time
meanings.sentence: I'll be with you momentarily.

meanings.definition: a person who is weak or easily frightened
meanings.sentence: He felt like a wimp for not standing up for himself.

meanings.definition: to push a sharp object into something or someone
meanings.sentence: She stabbed the meat to check if it was cooked.

meanings.definition: a person who takes advantage of others’ generosity
meanings.sentence: He’s such a freeloader, always joining us for meals without offering to help.

meanings.definition: an injury to a joint caused by twisting
meanings.sentence: She got a sprain in her ankle during the game.

meanings.definition: injured by twisting a joint
meanings.sentence: She sprained her ankle during the match.

meanings.definition: a break or crack in a bone
meanings.sentence: He had a hairline fracture in his wrist after falling.

meanings.definition: broken a bone
meanings.sentence: He fractured his wrist in the fall.

meanings.definition: to drink something quickly in large gulps
meanings.sentence: He chugged the soda in seconds.

meanings.definition: an old woman who is unpleasant or frightening
meanings.sentence: In the fairy tale, the witch appeared as a scary hag.

meanings.definition: to throw something with force
meanings.sentence: He flung the stone into the lake.

meanings.definition: full of or covered with stars
meanings.sentence: The sky was starry and clear tonight.

meanings.definition: the regular rise and fall of the sea
meanings.sentence: They watched the tide come in at the beach.

meanings.definition: to crush something into a fine powder
meanings.sentence: The machine can pulverize rocks into sand.

meanings.definition: to cut something into pieces with a sharp tool
meanings.sentence: Please chop the onions before adding them to the soup.

meanings.definition: a tool used for chopping
meanings.sentence: He used a chopper to split the firewood.

meanings.definition: a natural area left in its raw state
meanings.sentence: They spent the weekend camping in the wilderness.

meanings.definition: to try to please someone for personal gain
meanings.sentence: She always sucks up to her manager to get special favors.

meanings.definition: to support or maintain a decision or principle
meanings.sentence: The committee upheld the original agreement despite objections.

meanings.definition: to make a soft, gentle sound like a dove
meanings.sentence: The mother cooed softly to calm her crying baby.

meanings.definition: of the highest quality
meanings.sentence: Her performance was top notch and impressed everyone.

meanings.definition: suggesting that something bad will happen
meanings.sentence: The dark clouds gave the landscape an ominous look.

meanings.definition: serious and sad in mood
meanings.sentence: The ceremony was somber and respectful.

meanings.definition: in a silly or unwise manner
meanings.sentence: He foolishly ignored the warning signs.

meanings.definition: to stop breathing or have difficulty breathing because of a blocked throat
meanings.sentence: He choked on a piece of meat.

meanings.definition: a game in which you jump over a swinging rope
meanings.sentence: The children took turns using the jump rope at recess.

meanings.definition: Strange in a way that causes fear or unease.
meanings.sentence: The abandoned house had an eerie silence at night.

meanings.definition: Showing mental decline due to old age.
meanings.sentence: At times, his forgetfulness made him seem senile to his family.

meanings.definition: to bring someone or something back to life
meanings.sentence: In the legend, the sorcerer tried to resurrect the fallen king.

meanings.definition: the act of bringing someone back to life
meanings.sentence: The novel tells of the resurrection of an ancient king.

meanings.definition: a strong feeling of shock and anger
meanings.sentence: The community expressed outrage when they learned about the unfair policy.

meanings.definition: very shocking and unacceptable
meanings.sentence: It is outrageous that you have to pay so much for parking.

meanings.definition: to obtain something by force or threats
meanings.sentence: The gang tried to extort money from local shop owners.

meanings.definition: the act of getting money by force or threats
meanings.sentence: The company reported a case of extortion when a hacker demanded payment.

meanings.definition: to push or drive something forward
meanings.sentence: The strong wind helped propel the boat across the lake.

meanings.definition: the force that pushes an object forward
meanings.sentence: The rocket’s propulsion system uses powerful engines.

meanings.definition: a large meal, often for a special occasion
meanings.sentence: They prepared a feast for the holiday dinner.

meanings.definition: a low stool for resting your feet
meanings.sentence: She put her feet up on the footstool while reading.
